item.title: Report E-2024040458
item.description:
Report E-2024040458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding one punctured 1-gallon bottle of Master Care Pro-Red Plus™ as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 0.5-gallons of product spilled onto the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release using a citric acid solution and containerized the damaged product into one 35-gallon DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040252
item.description:
Report E-2024040252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. First Call Environmental personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum along with the damaged 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Upon inspection, I noticed box was punctured on the side and that one of the bottles was punctured causing internal leakage. DescribePack: Puncture on the side of one of the 1 Gallon bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in Red Hazmat Bin lined with clear Hazmat Bag

item.title: Report I-2024040070
item.description:
Report I-2024040070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: Grove City
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. One 55-gallon drum was punctured by a forklift while staged at the STG Logistics facility. Approximately 2 quarts of free liquid were released from the damaged drum to the warehouse floor. Area was secured and Green Charge was contracted to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival, free product was detected on the warehouse floor, and contained to immediate area. Green Charge utilized absorbent material and recovered all product. The damaged drum was overpacked to prevent further incident. Spent absorbents were placed into one 55-gallon drum, pending disposal in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately two quarts of regulated UN1325 "Lap Sealant" was released from a case containing (25) eleven-ounce tubes due to being punctured by a forklift. The release impacted Trailer #317-1650. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged case of tubes, impacted "Oil Dri", and spent PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3098 was damaged prior to arrival and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and further migrated to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged 55-gallon drum and placed it in a 95-gallon over-pack drum for disposal. TLE deployed soda ash to the impacted asphalt and trailer floor to neutralize the release. Crews utilized hand tools to collect all impacted soda ash from the asphalt and the trailer floor. All hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and thirteen (13) 35-gallon drums and added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040287

Report E-2024040287

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2.5-gallons of Isopropyl Alcohol released from one 5-gallon metal pail after it was punctured by a forklift. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and the caller determined that terminal staff were capable of cleaning the release with PPE on-site. The waste was containerized into one (1) 8-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040276
item.description:
Report X-2024040276

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: CAMBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was discovered wet by a Packages Handler, and they immediately brought it to QA's Attention. I got a Damage HazMat tote and put the damaged hazmat in the tote and back to the Damage HazMat Cage. DescribePack: The seal to the Delimer was not completely sealed and the lid was not tightened appropriately, causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lids were all checked and tightened appropriately to stop any leakage.
